statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: George Blagojevic hit four of Hartford's 15 3-pointers and finished with 23 points to help the Hawks beat Maryland-Baltimore County 88-65 Wednesday night.
article.headline: Blagojevic hits 4 of Hartford's 15 3s in 88-65 win over UMBC
article.linkText: Blagojevic hits 4 of Hartford's 15 3s in 88-65 win over UMBC
article.story: HARTFORD, Conn. -- George Blagojevic hit four of Hartford's 15 3-pointers and finished with 23 points to help the Hawks beat Maryland-Baltimore County 88-65 Wednesday night. Pancake Thomas added 20 points -- including five 3s -- six rebounds and six assists, while Jalen Ross and Evan Cooper scored 14 apiece for Hartford. The Hawks shot 56.6 percent (30 of 53) from the field, including 60 percent (15 of 25) from behind the arc, and had 23 assists -- all season highs. Hartford (8-20, 3-10) had eight steals and committed just seven turnovers. Blagojevic and Thomas hit back-to-back 3s to push Hartford's lead to 48-38 with 14:48 to play and UMBC (6-22, 2-11 America East Conference) trailed by at least five, and as many as 24, the rest of the way. Jourdan Grant and Will Darley led the Retrievers with 15 points apiece. Cody Joyce scored 13.
